Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cell

  • public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a cell of the sudoku puzzle to be solved.
    Author:
    Dale Peters

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cell(int initialValue)
      Creates an instance of the Cell class, representing a cell in the sudoku grid.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] getCandidates()
      Allows retrieval of a particular cell's possible values from another class.
      int getInitialValue()
      Allows retrieval of a particular cell's assigned value from another class.
      int getNumberOfNonZeroCandidates()
      Counts the number of candidates the cell has that aren't zero.
      boolean isSolved()
      Determines whether a cell has been assigned a permanent value by checking if the initialValue is not equal to 0.
      void removeAllCandidates()
      "Removes" all candidates of a cell (sets them to 0).
      void removeCandidate(int value)
      "Removes" a specific cell's candidate (sets it to 0).
      void setDefiniteValue(int value)
      Assigns a particular cell with a permanent value and "removes" all the cell's candidates (sets all elements of the candidates array to 0).
      int setNakedSingle()
      Checks if the number of candidates that aren't 0 is 1 and if so, sets the cell's permanent value to that candidate.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cell

        public Cell(int initialValue)
        Creates an instance of the Cell class, representing a cell in the sudoku grid. Fills the rest of the candidates array with 0.
        Parameters:
        initialValue - The value of the cell read in from the file, or 0 if the value is unknown

    • Method Detail

      • removeCandidate

        public void removeCandidate(int value)
        "Removes" a specific cell's candidate (sets it to 0).
        Parameters:
        value - The value to "remove" from the cell's candidates.

      • removeAllCandidates

        public void removeAllCandidates()
        "Removes" all candidates of a cell (sets them to 0).

      • getCandidates

        public int[] getCandidates()
        Allows retrieval of a particular cell's possible values from another class.
        Returns:
        The cell's candidates array.

      • getInitialValue

        public int getInitialValue()
        Allows retrieval of a particular cell's assigned value from another class.
        Returns:
        The cell's assigned value.

      • setNakedSingle

        public int setNakedSingle()
        Checks if the number of candidates that aren't 0 is 1 and if so, sets the cell's permanent value to that candidate.
        Returns:
        The permanent value the cell was assigned.

      • setDefiniteValue

        public void setDefiniteValue(int value)
        Assigns a particular cell with a permanent value and "removes" all the cell's candidates (sets all elements of the candidates array to 0).
        Parameters:
        value - The number to set to the cell's permanent value and remove from its candidates.

      • getNumberOfNonZeroCandidates

        public int getNumberOfNonZeroCandidates()
        Counts the number of candidates the cell has that aren't zero.
        Returns:
        The number of candidates that aren't zero.

      • isSolved

        public boolean isSolved()
        Determines whether a cell has been assigned a permanent value by checking if the initialValue is not equal to 0.
        Returns:
        True if the cell's permanent value is not equal to 0.
